isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Service Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Power Cylinders - Installation - Installing Piston and Connecting Rod Assembly

svcproc.title: Installing Piston and Connecting Rod Assembly

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, keep the fractured mating surfaces of the connecting rod and cap clean and free of lint and debris. Do not allow the mating surfaces to rest on any surface. Do not bump mating surfaces or drop the connecting rod or cap. This could cause chipping and wear on the mating surface, resulting in improper mating during installation and possible engine damage.

note.para: Turn the crankshaft so that the No. 1 and No. 6 connecting rod journals are at TDC. Install the No. 1 and No. 6 piston and connecting rod assemblies first. Then repeat the procedure for the No. 2 and No. 5 assemblies. Finish with the No. 3 and No. 4 assemblies.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, make sure that the longer side of the connecting rod bolted joint is oriented opposite the camshaft side of the engine.

step1.para: Lubricate the piston rings with clean engine oil. Stagger the piston ring gaps approximately 120 degrees around the piston.

figure.caption: Installing the piston ring compression tool

step1.para:
Install the piston ring compression tool
over the piston rings.
Lubricate the cylinder sleeve and connecting rod bearing shell with clean engine oil.

figure.caption: Installing the piston and connecting rod assembly

step1.para: Insert the piston and connecting rod assembly without the rod cap into the cylinder sleeve. Use a wooden or plastic handle to carefully push the assembly into the cylinder sleeve. Do not scratch the cylinder wall.
Carefully guide the piston and connecting rod assembly onto the crankshaft connecting rod journal.

caution.para: To avoid engine damage, always make sure the rod cap serial number is assembled to the same side as the connecting rod serial number (they must match). If the rod cap is reversed when assembled to the connecting rod or a rod cap is not installed on its original matching connecting rod, the fractured mating surfaces will be ruined. This may cause the rod cap to come loose and cause severe engine damage. The entire connecting rod assembly must then be replaced.

svcproc.para: The fractured mating surfaces of each rod and cap pair are precisely matched. Always keep each cap with its respective rod. If unsure, match the serial numbers on the sides of each rod and cap.

figure.caption: An offset indicates incorrect rod cap assembly

svcproc.para: The rod cap can only be correctly installed on the connecting rod if it is oriented in the correct direction. If the rod cap is reversed during assembly of the connecting rod, an obvious offset will be seen at the mating surfaces. If the connecting rod assembly is installed on the crankshaft in this manner, the connecting rod must be replaced. Also check the crankshaft journal fillets for damage. Such damage will require replacement of the crankshaft.

note.para: Each rod cap has an arrow for correct orientation in the engine during installation. The arrow must point toward the front of the engine.

step1.para: Lubricate the bearing shell in the connecting rod cap with clean engine oil.
Install the cap and two bolts.

figure.caption: Torquing the connecting rod cap bolts

step1.para: Torque the connecting rod cap bolts to the special torque value.
